page.title: 11The Fish Pond, Barton
page.content: One of the most beautiful features in Barton is the fish pond which is situated near to the Junior School and the Holland Sports Club.Although only a small shallow pool it attracts not only anglers but a wide variety of wild life.Trees surrounding the pond are Alders,Willows,Hawthorns and one Lombardy Poplar.The main marginal plants are Reed Mace with a few Yellow Flag Iris.Some of the water birds that nest by or use the pond are Coots,Moorhens, Blackheaded Gulls, Kingfishers and Grebes.Swans were removed last year suffering from lead shot poisoning and have not returned this year.Towards the centre of the pool is a man-made island planted with a willow sapling.It is hoped to encourage birds to nest there in the future.Dragonflies and a variety of insects live in and around the pond.
